creator: gregor@apache.org
text: are you willing to take this on, andreas?

i just discovered that debian does no longer have cocoon in testing, and forrest
is also pretty outdated. the danger with these things is that they get out of sync..
creator: gregor@apache.org
A.Kuckartz@ping.de
text:
It does not make much sense to create a Lenya package when not even a Cocoon
package exists.

For the status of the Debian Cocoon package see:
http://packages.qa.debian.org/c/cocoon2.html

Latest version: 2001-04-20
That was almost four years ago :-(

This situation does not make sense to me:
- Ola Lundqvist is listed as maintainer for cocoon2:
  http://packages.qa.debian.org/c/cocoon2.html
- cocoon2 is not listed on Ola Lundqvist's "Packages overview":
  http://qa.debian.org/developer.php?login=opal@debian.org
- cocoon2 is not on the list of Orphaned packages:
  http://www.debian.org/devel/wnpp/orphaned

Strange.

I will try to find out what is (not) going on.

(In reply to comment #5)

Ola Lundqvist, the former maintainer of the Debian cocoon2 package, replied:

"It has in fact been removed from Debian (developent version). The
cocoon package is just in the stable release. So I advice you
to use it from upstream.

The reasons is simply that it was too hard to manage as a Debian
package. Both from a packaging point of view and from a
license point of view."

---

It likely is even more difficult to maintain Lenya as a Debian package. I
therefore close this enhancement entry as WONTFIX.
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
